Authors:
Vladimiro Guarnaccia, Marcelo Patricio Sandoval-Denis,
Dalia Aiello, Giancarlo Polizzi, Pedro W. Crous
Title:
Neocosmospora perseae sp. nov., an agent of trunk cankers on
avocado in Italy
Abstract:
Trunk and branch cankers are among the most important
diseases compromising the avocado production worldwide. A novel species,
Neocosmospora perseae sp. nov. is described isolated from trunk lesions
on Persea americana in the main avocado producing area of Sicily, Italy.
The new species is characterised using a polyphasic approach including
morphological characters and a multilocus molecular phylogenetic
analysis based on partial sequences of the translation elongation
factor-1α, the internal transcribed spacer regions plus the large
subunit of the rDNA cistron, and the RNA polymerase II second largest
subunit. Pathogenicity testing and the fulfilment of Kochs postulates
confirm this species as a novel canker agent in Persea americana.
